Reviews.Title: Solid product, no issues after a few months of use
Reviews.Author: DZ102030
Reviews.Content: I bought this encoder to turn an existing CCTV surveillance camera into an IP camera.  It has worked flawlessly since the day I installed it.  I already had the camera connected to my CATV system, and with a frequency modulator, set it up so you could tune to a specific channel to see the camera feed from any TV in the house.I simply added a BNC video splitter to add the feed to the video encoder, and it worked first try.  The Gsurf software that comes with it is OK, but I would recommend something like Blue Iris, it is much more functional.  If the software had been "awesome," I would give this product 5 stars.This camera will work with Synology DSM 4.1, by the way.  However, Blue Iris is a lot cheaper than buying the camera licenses for the Synology NAS.I ended up buying another GrandStream wireless IP cam, and that also has been a solid performer, no hiccups or issues.

Reviews.Title: Not reliable and lacked easy setup.
Reviews.Author: Richard Silberman
Reviews.Content: Created a lot of difficulty when pairing with a Cradlepoint router. Too much configuration and intermittent operability. I wouldn't recommend this video server.

ProductInfo.Features:
Advanced multi-streaming-rate real-time H.264, Motion JPEG at D1 resolution
1 Analog video  inputs (BNC) and 1 alarm input & outputs
Integrated Power-over-Ethernet (802.3af), optional antenna for wireless network
◦SIP/VoIP support for two-way audio communications and video streaming to mobile phones and video phones
◦Combine with GSurf software to support remote viewing, controlling and recording of up to 36 cameras from anywhere on the Internet or corporate network.( GSurf Free Download)
ProductInfo.Name: GrandStream 1 Port IP Video Encoder
